headers.toc1: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians
headers.mt: The Epistle of Paul the Apostle to the Philippians

1.text: Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all the ones set apart in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons.

2.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

5.text: I give thanks for your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now.

6.text: I am confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ.

1.text: If there is therefore any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort from his love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any tender mercies and compassions,

3.text: Do nothing through selfishness or empty pride, but instead in lowliness of mind count others better than yourself.

4.text: Do not look out for each of your own needs, but also look out for the needs of others.
